messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] re:odd girl out
messages.msgSnippet: Schools are so unfriendly.  It makes me want to sob for all the persons who have to go there.  Lisa ... From: DIANE HAWKINS [mailto:momma60@msn.com] Sent:
messages.messageBody:
Schools are so unfriendly. It makes me want to sob for all the persons
who have to go there. Lisa

-----Original Message-----
From: DIANE HAWKINS [mailto:momma60@...]
Sent: Saturday, September 28, 2002 11:18 AM
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] re:odd girl out

how will the kids make friends?my two older children that went to school
made their friends from outside,not from school.some of their friends
went to their school,but that is not where they became friends.school is
not the environment to make friends.school is the place you learn to
make enemies.

life isn't fair.they need to learn this.-they don't need to be direct
victims of unfairness to understand that life can be unfair.(in school
many times the perpetrators are the faculty.)and if that was the case
then we would need to give our kids street drugs to teach them that
drugs are not good for them,and have our teenage daughters get pregnant
so they'll "learn" how tough it is to be a teen parent.sounds stupid
doesn't it.besides the statement that life isn't fair is not true.it can
be unfair or feel like it's unfair,but,especiallly in the free
world,life is only unfair if we let it be.we have alot more choices and
control over our circumstances than we realize if we look "outside the
box". and as far as dealing
with life i believe that if an unschooled child learns anything it is
that they do have control over their life.and who can deal with
something better than the one that has control over it?
diane in de


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
